Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Balteatide (natural AMPs; frogs, amphibians, animals; XXA; UCLL1c)
Sequence Information.Source: the skin secretion, wild Peruvian purple-sided leaf frogs,Phyllomedusa baltea; South America

Literature Information.Literature: 61.53% sequence similarity to AP905, Hyposin-H4. Active against the yeast C. albicans (MIC 27 uM), and weakly against the Gram-negative bacterium, E. coli (MIC 109 uM). Reg 6/17/2014.
Literature Information.Author: Ge L, Chen X, Ma C, Zhou M, Xia X, Wang L, Ding A, Duan J, Chen T, Shaw C. 2014
Literature Information.Reference: Sci World J 2014; 2014, article ID 176214.Online version
Literature Information.Title: Balteatide: a novel antimicrobial decapeptide from the skin secretion of the purple-sided leaf frog, Phyllomedusa baltea
